item.title: SymFlux: deep symbolic regression of Hamiltonian vector fields
item.description: arXiv:2507.06342v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We present SymFlux, a novel deep learning framework that performs symbolic regression to identify Hamiltonian functions from their corresponding vector fields on the standard symplectic plane. SymFlux models utilize hybrid CNN-LSTM architectures to learn and output the symbolic mathematical expression of the underlying Hamiltonian. Training and validation are conducted on newly developed datasets of Hamiltonian vector fields, a key contribution of this work. Our results demonstrate the model's effectiveness in accurately recovering these symbolic expressions, advancing automated discovery in Hamiltonian mechanics.
item.dc:creator: M. A. Evangelista-Alvarado, P. Su\'arez-Serrato

item.title: A hyperk\"ahler metric on twisted cotangent bundles of the complex projective space
item.description: arXiv:2507.06604v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We construct a hyperk\"ahler metric on twisted cotangent bundles of the complex projective space $\mathbb{CP}^n$ explicitly in terms of local coordinates. Note that the twisted cotangent bundles of $\mathbb{CP}^n$ are holomorphically isomorphic to complex semisimple coadjoint orbits of $\mathrm{SL}_{n+1}(\mathbb{C})$.
item.dc:creator: Takashi Hashimoto

item.title: A Twisted sl_2(C) Isomonodromic-Isospectral Correspondence
item.description: arXiv:2507.06668v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: The aim of this article is to generalize the isomonodromic-isospectral correspondence for meromorphic connections of rank $2$ over $\mathbb{P}^1$ to the twisted case. More specifically, the construction of the isospectral approach is provided for the Painlev\'{e} I hierarchy, then two maps are constructed, one linking the sets of isomonodromic and isospectral Hamiltonians, another linking the set of apparent singularities to a set of isospectral coordinates.
item.dc:creator: Mohamad Alameddine

item.title: Deformations of quasi-Hamiltonian spaces
item.description: arXiv:2505.16689v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We introduce a notion of deformations of quasi-Hamiltonian $G$-spaces to Hamiltonian $G$-spaces and provide several examples. In particular, we show that the double $G \times G$ of a Lie group, viewed as a quasi-Hamiltonian $G \times G$-space, deforms smoothly to the cotangent bundle $T^*G$. Likewise, any conjugacy class of $G$ sufficiently close to the identity deforms to a coadjoint orbit. We further show that the moduli space of flat $G$-connections on a compact oriented surface of genus $g$ with $r+1$ boundary components deforms to $T^*G^{r+g}$.
item.dc:creator: Jean-Philippe Burelle, Mohamed Moussadek Maiza, Maxence Mayrand

item.title: Stein-fillability and positivity in the mapping class group
item.description: arXiv:2405.07707v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We construct an infinite family of non-positive open books with once-punctured torus pages that support Stein-fillable contact structures. Combined with a result of Wendl, this allows us to give a complete answer to a long-standing question about the mapping class group of a compact surface with boundary: namely, we conclude that the monoid of monodromies supporting Stein-fillable contact structures is equal to the monoid of positive monodromies if and only if the surface is planar.
item.dc:creator: Vitalijs Brejevs, Andy Wand
